00028 // static helper method
00029 static btVector3
00030 getNormalizedVector(const btVector3& v)
00031 {
00032         btVector3 n(0, 0, 0);
00033 
00034         if (v.length() > SIMD_EPSILON) {
00035                 n = v.normalized();
00036         }
00037         return n;
00038 }

00047 class btKinematicClosestNotMeRayResultCallback : public btCollisionWorld::ClosestRayResultCallback
00048 {
00049 public:
00050         btKinematicClosestNotMeRayResultCallback (btCollisionObject* me) : btCollisionWorld::ClosestRayResultCallback(btVector3(0.0, 0.0, 0.0), btVector3(0.0, 0.0, 0.0))
00051         {
00052                 m_me = me;
00053         }
00054 
00055         virtual btScalar addSingleResult(btCollisionWorld::LocalRayResult& rayResult,bool normalInWorldSpace)
00056         {
00057                 if (rayResult.m_collisionObject == m_me)
00058                         return 1.0;
00059 
00060                 return ClosestRayResultCallback::addSingleResult (rayResult, normalInWorldSpace);
00061         }
00062 protected:
00063         btCollisionObject* m_me;
00064 };
00065 
00066 class btKinematicClosestNotMeConvexResultCallback : public btCollisionWorld::ClosestConvexResultCallback
00067 {
00068 public:
00069         btKinematicClosestNotMeConvexResultCallback (btCollisionObject* me, const btVector3& up, btScalar minSlopeDot)
00070         : btCollisionWorld::ClosestConvexResultCallback(btVector3(0.0, 0.0, 0.0), btVector3(0.0, 0.0, 0.0))
00071         , m_me(me)
00072         , m_up(up)
00073         , m_minSlopeDot(minSlopeDot)
00074         {
00075         }
00076 
00077         virtual btScalar addSingleResult(btCollisionWorld::LocalConvexResult& convexResult,bool normalInWorldSpace)
00078         {
00079                 if (convexResult.m_hitCollisionObject == m_me)
00080                         return btScalar(1.0);
00081 
00082                 if (!convexResult.m_hitCollisionObject->hasContactResponse())
00083                         return btScalar(1.0);
00084 
00085                 btVector3 hitNormalWorld;
00086                 if (normalInWorldSpace)
00087                 {
00088                         hitNormalWorld = convexResult.m_hitNormalLocal;
00089                 } else
00090                 {
00092                         hitNormalWorld = convexResult.m_hitCollisionObject->getWorldTransform().getBasis()*convexResult.m_hitNormalLocal;
00093                 }
00094 
00095                 btScalar dotUp = m_up.dot(hitNormalWorld);
00096                 if (dotUp < m_minSlopeDot) {
00097                         return btScalar(1.0);
00098                 }
00099 
00100                 return ClosestConvexResultCallback::addSingleResult (convexResult, normalInWorldSpace);
00101         }
00102 protected:
00103         btCollisionObject* m_me;
00104         const btVector3 m_up;
00105         btScalar m_minSlopeDot;
00106 };
00107 
00108 /*
00109  * Returns the reflection direction of a ray going 'direction' hitting a surface with normal 'normal'
00110  *
00111  * from: http://www-cs-students.stanford.edu/~adityagp/final/node3.html
00112  */
00113 btVector3 btKinematicCharacterController::computeReflectionDirection (const btVector3& direction, const btVector3& normal)
00114 {
00115         return direction - (btScalar(2.0) * direction.dot(normal)) * normal;
00116 }
00117 
00118 /*
00119  * Returns the portion of 'direction' that is parallel to 'normal'
00120  */
00121 btVector3 btKinematicCharacterController::parallelComponent (const btVector3& direction, const btVector3& normal)
00122 {
00123         btScalar magnitude = direction.dot(normal);
00124         return normal * magnitude;
00125 }
00126 
00127 /*
00128  * Returns the portion of 'direction' that is perpindicular to 'normal'
00129  */
00130 btVector3 btKinematicCharacterController::perpindicularComponent (const btVector3& direction, const btVector3& normal)
00131 {
00132         return direction - parallelComponent(direction, normal);
00133 }
00134 
00135 btKinematicCharacterController::btKinematicCharacterController (btPairCachingGhostObject* ghostObject,btConvexShape* convexShape,btScalar stepHeight, const btVector3& up)
00136 {
00137         m_ghostObject = ghostObject;
00138         m_up.setValue(0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
00139         m_jumpAxis.setValue(0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
00140         m_addedMargin = 0.02;
00141         m_walkDirection.setValue(0.0,0.0,0.0);
00142         m_AngVel.setValue(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
00143         m_useGhostObjectSweepTest = true;       
00144         m_turnAngle = btScalar(0.0);
00145         m_convexShape=convexShape;      
00146         m_useWalkDirection = true;      // use walk direction by default, legacy behavior
00147         m_velocityTimeInterval = 0.0;
00148         m_verticalVelocity = 0.0;
00149         m_verticalOffset = 0.0;
00150         m_gravity = 9.8 * 3.0 ; // 3G acceleration.
00151         m_fallSpeed = 55.0; // Terminal velocity of a sky diver in m/s.
00152         m_jumpSpeed = 10.0; // ?
00153         m_SetjumpSpeed = m_jumpSpeed;
00154         m_wasOnGround = false;
00155         m_wasJumping = false;
00156         m_interpolateUp = true;
00157         m_currentStepOffset = 0.0;
00158         m_maxPenetrationDepth = 0.2;
00159         full_drop = false;
00160         bounce_fix = false;
00161         m_linearDamping = btScalar(0.0);
00162         m_angularDamping = btScalar(0.0);
00163 
00164         setUp(up);
00165         setStepHeight(stepHeight);
00166         setMaxSlope(btRadians(45.0));
00167 }

00169 btKinematicCharacterController::~btKinematicCharacterController ()
00170 {
00171 }

00173 btPairCachingGhostObject* btKinematicCharacterController::getGhostObject()
00174 {
00175         return m_ghostObject;
00176 }

00178 bool btKinematicCharacterController::recoverFromPenetration ( btCollisionWorld* collisionWorld)
00179 {
00180         // Here we must refresh the overlapping paircache as the penetrating movement itself or the
00181         // previous recovery iteration might have used setWorldTransform and pushed us into an object
00182         // that is not in the previous cache contents from the last timestep, as will happen if we
00183         // are pushed into a new AABB overlap. Unhandled this means the next convex sweep gets stuck.
00184         //
00185         // Do this by calling the broadphase's setAabb with the moved AABB, this will update the broadphase
00186         // paircache and the ghostobject's internal paircache at the same time.    /BW
00187 
00188         btVector3 minAabb, maxAabb;
00189         m_convexShape->getAabb(m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform(), minAabb,maxAabb);
00190         collisionWorld->getBroadphase()->setAabb(m_ghostObject->getBroadphaseHandle(), 
00191                                                  minAabb, 
00192                                                  maxAabb, 
00193                                                  collisionWorld->getDispatcher());
00194                                                  
00195         bool penetration = false;
00196 
00197         collisionWorld->getDispatcher()->dispatchAllCollisionPairs(m_ghostObject->getOverlappingPairCache(), collisionWorld->getDispatchInfo(), collisionWorld->getDispatcher());
00198 
00199         m_currentPosition = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform().getOrigin();
00200         
00201 //      btScalar maxPen = btScalar(0.0);
00202         for (int i = 0; i < m_ghostObject->getOverlappingPairCache()->getNumOverlappingPairs(); i++)
00203         {
00204                 m_manifoldArray.resize(0);
00205 
00206                 btBroadphasePair* collisionPair = &m_ghostObject->getOverlappingPairCache()->getOverlappingPairArray()[i];
00207 
00208                 btCollisionObject* obj0 = static_cast<btCollisionObject*>(collisionPair->m_pProxy0->m_clientObject);
00209         btCollisionObject* obj1 = static_cast<btCollisionObject*>(collisionPair->m_pProxy1->m_clientObject);
00210 
00211                 if ((obj0 && !obj0->hasContactResponse()) || (obj1 && !obj1->hasContactResponse()))
00212                         continue;
00213 
00214                 if (!needsCollision(obj0, obj1))
00215                         continue;
00216                 
00217                 if (collisionPair->m_algorithm)
00218                         collisionPair->m_algorithm->getAllContactManifolds(m_manifoldArray);
00219 
00220                 
00221                 for (int j=0;j<m_manifoldArray.size();j++)
00222                 {
00223                         btPersistentManifold* manifold = m_manifoldArray[j];
00224                         btScalar directionSign = manifold->getBody0() == m_ghostObject ? btScalar(-1.0) : btScalar(1.0);
00225                         for (int p=0;p<manifold->getNumContacts();p++)
00226                         {
00227                                 const btManifoldPoint&pt = manifold->getContactPoint(p);
00228 
00229                                 btScalar dist = pt.getDistance();
00230 
00231                                 if (dist < -m_maxPenetrationDepth)
00232                                 {
00233                                         // TODO: cause problems on slopes, not sure if it is needed
00234                                         //if (dist < maxPen)
00235                                         //{
00236                                         //      maxPen = dist;
00237                                         //      m_touchingNormal = pt.m_normalWorldOnB * directionSign;//??
00238 
00239                                         //}
00240                                         m_currentPosition += pt.m_normalWorldOnB * directionSign * dist * btScalar(0.2);
00241                                         penetration = true;
00242                                 } else {
00243                                         //printf("touching %f\n", dist);
00244                                 }
00245                         }
00246                         
00247                         //manifold->clearManifold();
00248                 }
00249         }
00250         btTransform newTrans = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform();
00251         newTrans.setOrigin(m_currentPosition);
00252         m_ghostObject->setWorldTransform(newTrans);
00253 //      printf("m_touchingNormal = %f,%f,%f\n",m_touchingNormal[0],m_touchingNormal[1],m_touchingNormal[2]);
00254         return penetration;
00255 }
00256 
00257 void btKinematicCharacterController::stepUp ( btCollisionWorld* world)
00258 {
00259         btScalar stepHeight = 0.0f;
00260         if (m_verticalVelocity < 0.0)
00261                 stepHeight = m_stepHeight;
00262 
00263         // phase 1: up
00264         btTransform start, end;
00265 
00266         start.setIdentity ();
00267         end.setIdentity ();
00268 
00269         /* FIXME: Handle penetration properly */
00270         start.setOrigin(m_currentPosition);
00271 
00272         m_targetPosition = m_currentPosition + m_up * (stepHeight) + m_jumpAxis * ((m_verticalOffset > 0.f ? m_verticalOffset : 0.f));
00273         m_currentPosition = m_targetPosition;
00274 
00275         end.setOrigin (m_targetPosition);
00276 
00277         start.setRotation(m_currentOrientation);
00278         end.setRotation(m_targetOrientation);
00279 
00280         btKinematicClosestNotMeConvexResultCallback callback(m_ghostObject, -m_up, m_maxSlopeCosine);
00281         callback.m_collisionFilterGroup = getGhostObject()->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterGroup;
00282         callback.m_collisionFilterMask = getGhostObject()->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterMask;
00283         
00284         if (m_useGhostObjectSweepTest)
00285         {
00286                 m_ghostObject->convexSweepTest (m_convexShape, start, end, callback, world->getDispatchInfo().m_allowedCcdPenetration);
00287         }
00288         else
00289         {
00290                 world->convexSweepTest(m_convexShape, start, end, callback, world->getDispatchInfo().m_allowedCcdPenetration);
00291         }
00292 
00293         if (callback.hasHit() && m_ghostObject->hasContactResponse() && needsCollision(m_ghostObject, callback.m_hitCollisionObject))
00294         {
00295                 // Only modify the position if the hit was a slope and not a wall or ceiling.
00296                 if (callback.m_hitNormalWorld.dot(m_up) > 0.0)
00297                 {
00298                         // we moved up only a fraction of the step height
00299                         m_currentStepOffset = stepHeight * callback.m_closestHitFraction;
00300                         if (m_interpolateUp == true)
00301                                 m_currentPosition.setInterpolate3 (m_currentPosition, m_targetPosition, callback.m_closestHitFraction);
00302                         else
00303                                 m_currentPosition = m_targetPosition;
00304                 }
00305 
00306                 btTransform& xform = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform();
00307                 xform.setOrigin(m_currentPosition);
00308                 m_ghostObject->setWorldTransform(xform);
00309 
00310                 // fix penetration if we hit a ceiling for example
00311                 int numPenetrationLoops = 0;
00312                 m_touchingContact = false;
00313                 while (recoverFromPenetration(world))
00314                 {
00315                         numPenetrationLoops++;
00316                         m_touchingContact = true;
00317                         if (numPenetrationLoops > 4)
00318                         {
00319                                 //printf("character could not recover from penetration = %d\n", numPenetrationLoops);
00320                                 break;
00321                         }
00322                 }
00323                 m_targetPosition = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform().getOrigin();
00324                 m_currentPosition = m_targetPosition;
00325 
00326                 if (m_verticalOffset > 0)
00327                 {
00328                         m_verticalOffset = 0.0;
00329                         m_verticalVelocity = 0.0;
00330                         m_currentStepOffset = m_stepHeight;
00331                 }
00332         } else {
00333                 m_currentStepOffset = stepHeight;
00334                 m_currentPosition = m_targetPosition;
00335         }
00336 }
00337 
00338 bool btKinematicCharacterController::needsCollision(const btCollisionObject* body0, const btCollisionObject* body1)
00339 {
00340         bool collides = (body0->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterGroup & body1->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterMask) != 0;
00341         collides = collides && (body1->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterGroup & body0->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterMask);
00342         return collides;
00343 }
00344 
00345 void btKinematicCharacterController::updateTargetPositionBasedOnCollision (const btVector3& hitNormal, btScalar tangentMag, btScalar normalMag)
00346 {
00347         btVector3 movementDirection = m_targetPosition - m_currentPosition;
00348         btScalar movementLength = movementDirection.length();
00349         if (movementLength>SIMD_EPSILON)
00350         {
00351                 movementDirection.normalize();
00352 
00353                 btVector3 reflectDir = computeReflectionDirection (movementDirection, hitNormal);
00354                 reflectDir.normalize();
00355 
00356                 btVector3 parallelDir, perpindicularDir;
00357 
00358                 parallelDir = parallelComponent (reflectDir, hitNormal);
00359                 perpindicularDir = perpindicularComponent (reflectDir, hitNormal);
00360 
00361                 m_targetPosition = m_currentPosition;
00362                 if (0)//tangentMag != 0.0)
00363                 {
00364                         btVector3 parComponent = parallelDir * btScalar (tangentMag*movementLength);
00365 //                      printf("parComponent=%f,%f,%f\n",parComponent[0],parComponent[1],parComponent[2]);
00366                         m_targetPosition +=  parComponent;
00367                 }
00368 
00369                 if (normalMag != 0.0)
00370                 {
00371                         btVector3 perpComponent = perpindicularDir * btScalar (normalMag*movementLength);
00372 //                      printf("perpComponent=%f,%f,%f\n",perpComponent[0],perpComponent[1],perpComponent[2]);
00373                         m_targetPosition += perpComponent;
00374                 }
00375         } else
00376         {
00377 //              printf("movementLength don't normalize a zero vector\n");
00378         }
00379 }
00380 
00381 void btKinematicCharacterController::stepForwardAndStrafe ( btCollisionWorld* collisionWorld, const btVector3& walkMove)
00382 {
00383         // printf("m_normalizedDirection=%f,%f,%f\n",
00384         //      m_normalizedDirection[0],m_normalizedDirection[1],m_normalizedDirection[2]);
00385         // phase 2: forward and strafe
00386         btTransform start, end;
00387 
00388         m_targetPosition = m_currentPosition + walkMove;
00389 
00390         start.setIdentity ();
00391         end.setIdentity ();
00392         
00393         btScalar fraction = 1.0;
00394         btScalar distance2 = (m_currentPosition-m_targetPosition).length2();
00395 //      printf("distance2=%f\n",distance2);
00396 
00397         int maxIter = 10;
00398 
00399         while (fraction > btScalar(0.01) && maxIter-- > 0)
00400         {
00401                 start.setOrigin (m_currentPosition);
00402                 end.setOrigin (m_targetPosition);
00403                 btVector3 sweepDirNegative(m_currentPosition - m_targetPosition);
00404 
00405                 start.setRotation(m_currentOrientation);
00406                 end.setRotation(m_targetOrientation);
00407 
00408                 btKinematicClosestNotMeConvexResultCallback callback (m_ghostObject, sweepDirNegative, btScalar(0.0));
00409                 callback.m_collisionFilterGroup = getGhostObject()->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterGroup;
00410                 callback.m_collisionFilterMask = getGhostObject()->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterMask;
00411 
00412 
00413                 btScalar margin = m_convexShape->getMargin();
00414                 m_convexShape->setMargin(margin + m_addedMargin);
00415 
00416                 if (!(start == end))
00417                 {
00418                         if (m_useGhostObjectSweepTest)
00419                         {
00420                                 m_ghostObject->convexSweepTest(m_convexShape, start, end, callback, collisionWorld->getDispatchInfo().m_allowedCcdPenetration);
00421                         }
00422                         else
00423                         {
00424                                 collisionWorld->convexSweepTest(m_convexShape, start, end, callback, collisionWorld->getDispatchInfo().m_allowedCcdPenetration);
00425                         }
00426                 }
00427                 m_convexShape->setMargin(margin);
00428 
00429                 
00430                 fraction -= callback.m_closestHitFraction;
00431 
00432                 if (callback.hasHit() && m_ghostObject->hasContactResponse() && needsCollision(m_ghostObject, callback.m_hitCollisionObject))
00433                 {       
00434                         // we moved only a fraction
00435                         //btScalar hitDistance;
00436                         //hitDistance = (callback.m_hitPointWorld - m_currentPosition).length();
00437 
00438 //                      m_currentPosition.setInterpolate3 (m_currentPosition, m_targetPosition, callback.m_closestHitFraction);
00439 
00440                         updateTargetPositionBasedOnCollision (callback.m_hitNormalWorld);
00441                         btVector3 currentDir = m_targetPosition - m_currentPosition;
00442                         distance2 = currentDir.length2();
00443                         if (distance2 > SIMD_EPSILON)
00444                         {
00445                                 currentDir.normalize();
00446                                 /* See Quake2: "If velocity is against original velocity, stop ead to avoid tiny oscilations in sloping corners." */
00447                                 if (currentDir.dot(m_normalizedDirection) <= btScalar(0.0))
00448                                 {
00449                                         break;
00450                                 }
00451                         } else
00452                         {
00453 //                              printf("currentDir: don't normalize a zero vector\n");
00454                                 break;
00455                         }
00456 
00457                 }
00458         else
00459         {
00460             m_currentPosition = m_targetPosition;
00461                 }
00462         }
00463 }
00464 
00465 void btKinematicCharacterController::stepDown ( btCollisionWorld* collisionWorld, btScalar dt)
00466 {
00467         btTransform start, end, end_double;
00468         bool runonce = false;
00469 
00470         // phase 3: down
00471         /*btScalar additionalDownStep = (m_wasOnGround && !onGround()) ? m_stepHeight : 0.0;
00472         btVector3 step_drop = m_up * (m_currentStepOffset + additionalDownStep);
00473         btScalar downVelocity = (additionalDownStep == 0.0 && m_verticalVelocity<0.0?-m_verticalVelocity:0.0) * dt;
00474         btVector3 gravity_drop = m_up * downVelocity; 
00475         m_targetPosition -= (step_drop + gravity_drop);*/
00476 
00477         btVector3 orig_position = m_targetPosition;
00478         
00479         btScalar downVelocity = (m_verticalVelocity<0.f?-m_verticalVelocity:0.f) * dt;
00480 
00481         if (m_verticalVelocity > 0.0)
00482                 return;
00483 
00484         if(downVelocity > 0.0 && downVelocity > m_fallSpeed
00485                 && (m_wasOnGround || !m_wasJumping))
00486                 downVelocity = m_fallSpeed;
00487 
00488         btVector3 step_drop = m_up * (m_currentStepOffset + downVelocity);
00489         m_targetPosition -= step_drop;
00490 
00491         btKinematicClosestNotMeConvexResultCallback callback(m_ghostObject, m_up, m_maxSlopeCosine);
00492         callback.m_collisionFilterGroup = getGhostObject()->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterGroup;
00493         callback.m_collisionFilterMask = getGhostObject()->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterMask;
00494 
00495         btKinematicClosestNotMeConvexResultCallback callback2(m_ghostObject, m_up, m_maxSlopeCosine);
00496         callback2.m_collisionFilterGroup = getGhostObject()->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterGroup;
00497         callback2.m_collisionFilterMask = getGhostObject()->getBroadphaseHandle()->m_collisionFilterMask;
00498 
00499         while (1)
00500         {
00501                 start.setIdentity ();
00502                 end.setIdentity ();
00503 
00504                 end_double.setIdentity ();
00505 
00506                 start.setOrigin (m_currentPosition);
00507                 end.setOrigin (m_targetPosition);
00508 
00509                 start.setRotation(m_currentOrientation);
00510                 end.setRotation(m_targetOrientation);
00511 
00512                 //set double test for 2x the step drop, to check for a large drop vs small drop
00513                 end_double.setOrigin (m_targetPosition - step_drop);
00514 
00515                 if (m_useGhostObjectSweepTest)
00516                 {
00517                         m_ghostObject->convexSweepTest (m_convexShape, start, end, callback, collisionWorld->getDispatchInfo().m_allowedCcdPenetration);
00518 
00519                         if (!callback.hasHit() && m_ghostObject->hasContactResponse())
00520                         {
00521                                 //test a double fall height, to see if the character should interpolate it's fall (full) or not (partial)
00522                                 m_ghostObject->convexSweepTest (m_convexShape, start, end_double, callback2, collisionWorld->getDispatchInfo().m_allowedCcdPenetration);
00523                         }
00524                 } else
00525                 {
00526                         collisionWorld->convexSweepTest (m_convexShape, start, end, callback, collisionWorld->getDispatchInfo().m_allowedCcdPenetration);
00527 
00528                         if (!callback.hasHit() && m_ghostObject->hasContactResponse())
00529                         {
00530                                 //test a double fall height, to see if the character should interpolate it's fall (large) or not (small)
00531                                 collisionWorld->convexSweepTest (m_convexShape, start, end_double, callback2, collisionWorld->getDispatchInfo().m_allowedCcdPenetration);
00532                         }
00533                 }
00534         
00535                 btScalar downVelocity2 = (m_verticalVelocity<0.f?-m_verticalVelocity:0.f) * dt;
00536                 bool has_hit;
00537                 if (bounce_fix == true)
00538                         has_hit = (callback.hasHit() || callback2.hasHit()) && m_ghostObject->hasContactResponse() && needsCollision(m_ghostObject, callback.m_hitCollisionObject);
00539                 else
00540                         has_hit = callback2.hasHit() && m_ghostObject->hasContactResponse() && needsCollision(m_ghostObject, callback2.m_hitCollisionObject);
00541 
00542                 btScalar stepHeight = 0.0f;
00543                 if (m_verticalVelocity < 0.0)
00544                         stepHeight = m_stepHeight;
00545 
00546                 if (downVelocity2 > 0.0 && downVelocity2 < stepHeight && has_hit == true && runonce == false
00547                                         && (m_wasOnGround || !m_wasJumping))
00548                 {
00549                         //redo the velocity calculation when falling a small amount, for fast stairs motion
00550                         //for larger falls, use the smoother/slower interpolated movement by not touching the target position
00551 
00552                         m_targetPosition = orig_position;
00553                         downVelocity = stepHeight;
00554 
00555                         step_drop = m_up * (m_currentStepOffset + downVelocity);
00556                         m_targetPosition -= step_drop;
00557                         runonce = true;
00558                         continue; //re-run previous tests
00559                 }
00560                 break;
00561         }
00562 
00563         if ((m_ghostObject->hasContactResponse() && (callback.hasHit() && needsCollision(m_ghostObject, callback.m_hitCollisionObject))) || runonce == true)
00564         {
00565                 // we dropped a fraction of the height -> hit floor
00566                 btScalar fraction = (m_currentPosition.getY() - callback.m_hitPointWorld.getY()) / 2;
00567 
00568                 //printf("hitpoint: %g - pos %g\n", callback.m_hitPointWorld.getY(), m_currentPosition.getY());
00569 
00570                 if (bounce_fix == true)
00571                 {
00572                         if (full_drop == true)
00573                                 m_currentPosition.setInterpolate3 (m_currentPosition, m_targetPosition, callback.m_closestHitFraction);
00574             else
00575                                 //due to errors in the closestHitFraction variable when used with large polygons, calculate the hit fraction manually
00576                                 m_currentPosition.setInterpolate3 (m_currentPosition, m_targetPosition, fraction);
00577                 }
00578                 else
00579                         m_currentPosition.setInterpolate3 (m_currentPosition, m_targetPosition, callback.m_closestHitFraction);
00580 
00581                 full_drop = false;
00582 
00583                 m_verticalVelocity = 0.0;
00584                 m_verticalOffset = 0.0;
00585                 m_wasJumping = false;
00586         } else {
00587                 // we dropped the full height
00588 
00589                 full_drop = true;
00590 
00591                 if (bounce_fix == true)
00592                 {
00593                         downVelocity = (m_verticalVelocity<0.f?-m_verticalVelocity:0.f) * dt;
00594                         if (downVelocity > m_fallSpeed && (m_wasOnGround || !m_wasJumping))
00595                         {
00596                                 m_targetPosition += step_drop; //undo previous target change
00597                                 downVelocity = m_fallSpeed;
00598                                 step_drop = m_up * (m_currentStepOffset + downVelocity);
00599                                 m_targetPosition -= step_drop;
00600                         }
00601                 }
00602                 //printf("full drop - %g, %g\n", m_currentPosition.getY(), m_targetPosition.getY());
00603 
00604                 m_currentPosition = m_targetPosition;
00605         }
00606 }
00607

00648 
00649 void btKinematicCharacterController::setLinearVelocity(const btVector3& velocity)
00650 {
00651         m_walkDirection = velocity;
00652 
00653         // HACK: if we are moving in the direction of the up, treat it as a jump :(
00654         if (m_walkDirection.length2() > 0)
00655         {
00656                 btVector3 w = velocity.normalized();
00657                 btScalar c = w.dot(m_up);
00658                 if (c != 0)
00659                 {
00660                         //there is a component in walkdirection for vertical velocity
00661                         btVector3 upComponent = m_up * (btSin(SIMD_HALF_PI - btAcos(c)) * m_walkDirection.length());
00662                         m_walkDirection -= upComponent;
00663                         m_verticalVelocity = (c < 0.0f ? -1 : 1) * upComponent.length();
00664                         
00665                         if (c > 0.0f)
00666                         {
00667                                 m_wasJumping = true;
00668                                 m_jumpPosition = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform().getOrigin();
00669                         }
00670                 }
00671         }
00672         else
00673                 m_verticalVelocity = 0.0f;
00674 }
00675 
00676 btVector3 btKinematicCharacterController::getLinearVelocity() const
00677 {
00678         return m_walkDirection + (m_verticalVelocity * m_up);
00679 }
00680 
00681 void btKinematicCharacterController::reset ( btCollisionWorld* collisionWorld )
00682 {
00683     m_verticalVelocity = 0.0;
00684     m_verticalOffset = 0.0;
00685     m_wasOnGround = false;
00686     m_wasJumping = false;
00687     m_walkDirection.setValue(0,0,0);
00688     m_velocityTimeInterval = 0.0;
00689 
00690     //clear pair cache
00691     btHashedOverlappingPairCache *cache = m_ghostObject->getOverlappingPairCache();
00692     while (cache->getOverlappingPairArray().size() > 0)
00693     {
00694             cache->removeOverlappingPair(cache->getOverlappingPairArray()[0].m_pProxy0, cache->getOverlappingPairArray()[0].m_pProxy1, collisionWorld->getDispatcher());
00695     }
00696 }

00698 void btKinematicCharacterController::warp (const btVector3& origin)
00699 {
00700         btTransform xform;
00701         xform.setIdentity();
00702         xform.setOrigin (origin);
00703         m_ghostObject->setWorldTransform (xform);
00704 }

00707 void btKinematicCharacterController::preStep (  btCollisionWorld* collisionWorld)
00708 {
00709         m_currentPosition = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform().getOrigin();
00710         m_targetPosition = m_currentPosition;
00711 
00712         m_currentOrientation = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform().getRotation();
00713         m_targetOrientation = m_currentOrientation;
00714 //      printf("m_targetPosition=%f,%f,%f\n",m_targetPosition[0],m_targetPosition[1],m_targetPosition[2]);
00715 }
00716 
00717 void btKinematicCharacterController::playerStep (  btCollisionWorld* collisionWorld, btScalar dt)
00718 {
00719 //      printf("playerStep(): ");
00720 //      printf("  dt = %f", dt);
00721 
00722         if (m_AngVel.length2() > 0.0f)
00723         {
00724                 m_AngVel *= btPow(btScalar(1) - m_angularDamping, dt);
00725         }
00726 
00727         // integrate for angular velocity
00728         if (m_AngVel.length2() > 0.0f)
00729         {
00730                 btTransform xform;
00731                 xform = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform();
00732 
00733                 btQuaternion rot(m_AngVel.normalized(), m_AngVel.length() * dt);
00734 
00735                 btQuaternion orn = rot * xform.getRotation();
00736 
00737                 xform.setRotation(orn);
00738                 m_ghostObject->setWorldTransform(xform);
00739 
00740                 m_currentPosition = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform().getOrigin();
00741                 m_targetPosition = m_currentPosition;
00742                 m_currentOrientation = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform().getRotation();
00743                 m_targetOrientation = m_currentOrientation;
00744         }
00745 
00746         // quick check...
00747         if (!m_useWalkDirection && (m_velocityTimeInterval <= 0.0)) {
00748 //              printf("\n");
00749                 return;         // no motion
00750         }
00751 
00752         m_wasOnGround = onGround();
00753 
00754         //btVector3 lvel = m_walkDirection;
00755         //btScalar c = 0.0f;
00756         
00757         if (m_walkDirection.length2() > 0)
00758         {
00759                 // apply damping
00760                 m_walkDirection *= btPow(btScalar(1) - m_linearDamping, dt);
00761         }
00762 
00763         m_verticalVelocity *= btPow(btScalar(1) - m_linearDamping, dt);
00764         
00765         // Update fall velocity.
00766         m_verticalVelocity -= m_gravity * dt;
00767         if (m_verticalVelocity > 0.0 && m_verticalVelocity > m_jumpSpeed)
00768         {
00769                 m_verticalVelocity = m_jumpSpeed;
00770         }
00771         if (m_verticalVelocity < 0.0 && btFabs(m_verticalVelocity) > btFabs(m_fallSpeed))
00772         {
00773                 m_verticalVelocity = -btFabs(m_fallSpeed);
00774         }
00775         m_verticalOffset = m_verticalVelocity * dt;
00776 
00777         btTransform xform;
00778         xform = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform();
00779 
00780 //      printf("walkDirection(%f,%f,%f)\n",walkDirection[0],walkDirection[1],walkDirection[2]);
00781 //      printf("walkSpeed=%f\n",walkSpeed);
00782 
00783         stepUp(collisionWorld);
00784         //todo: Experimenting with behavior of controller when it hits a ceiling..
00785         //bool hitUp = stepUp (collisionWorld); 
00786         //if (hitUp)
00787         //{
00788         //      m_verticalVelocity -= m_gravity * dt;
00789         //      if (m_verticalVelocity > 0.0 && m_verticalVelocity > m_jumpSpeed)
00790         //      {
00791         //              m_verticalVelocity = m_jumpSpeed;
00792         //      }
00793         //      if (m_verticalVelocity < 0.0 && btFabs(m_verticalVelocity) > btFabs(m_fallSpeed))
00794         //      {
00795         //              m_verticalVelocity = -btFabs(m_fallSpeed);
00796         //      }
00797         //      m_verticalOffset = m_verticalVelocity * dt;
00798 
00799         //      xform = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform();
00800         //}
00801 
00802         if (m_useWalkDirection) {
00803                 stepForwardAndStrafe (collisionWorld, m_walkDirection);
00804         } else {
00805                 //printf("  time: %f", m_velocityTimeInterval);
00806                 // still have some time left for moving!
00807                 btScalar dtMoving =
00808                         (dt < m_velocityTimeInterval) ? dt : m_velocityTimeInterval;
00809                 m_velocityTimeInterval -= dt;
00810 
00811                 // how far will we move while we are moving?
00812                 btVector3 move = m_walkDirection * dtMoving;
00813 
00814                 //printf("  dtMoving: %f", dtMoving);
00815 
00816                 // okay, step
00817                 stepForwardAndStrafe(collisionWorld, move);
00818         }
00819         stepDown (collisionWorld, dt);
00820 
00821         //todo: Experimenting with max jump height
00822         //if (m_wasJumping)
00823         //{
00824         //      btScalar ds = m_currentPosition[m_upAxis] - m_jumpPosition[m_upAxis];
00825         //      if (ds > m_maxJumpHeight)
00826         //      {
00827         //              // substract the overshoot
00828         //              m_currentPosition[m_upAxis] -= ds - m_maxJumpHeight;
00829 
00830         //              // max height was reached, so potential energy is at max 
00831         //              // and kinematic energy is 0, thus velocity is 0.
00832         //              if (m_verticalVelocity > 0.0)
00833         //                      m_verticalVelocity = 0.0;
00834         //      }
00835         //}
00836         // printf("\n");
00837 
00838         xform.setOrigin (m_currentPosition);
00839         m_ghostObject->setWorldTransform (xform);
00840 
00841         int numPenetrationLoops = 0;
00842         m_touchingContact = false;
00843         while (recoverFromPenetration(collisionWorld))
00844         {
00845                 numPenetrationLoops++;
00846                 m_touchingContact = true;
00847                 if (numPenetrationLoops > 4)
00848                 {
00849                         //printf("character could not recover from penetration = %d\n", numPenetrationLoops);
00850                         break;
00851                 }
00852         }
00853 }

00876 void btKinematicCharacterController::jump(const btVector3& v)
00877 {
00878         m_jumpSpeed = v.length2() == 0 ? m_SetjumpSpeed : v.length();
00879         m_verticalVelocity = m_jumpSpeed;
00880         m_wasJumping = true;
00881 
00882         m_jumpAxis = v.length2() == 0 ? m_up : v.normalized();
00883 
00884         m_jumpPosition = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform().getOrigin();
00885 
00886 #if 0
00887         currently no jumping.
00888         btTransform xform;
00889         m_rigidBody->getMotionState()->getWorldTransform (xform);
00890         btVector3 up = xform.getBasis()[1];
00891         up.normalize ();
00892         btScalar magnitude = (btScalar(1.0)/m_rigidBody->getInvMass()) * btScalar(8.0);
00893         m_rigidBody->applyCentralImpulse (up * magnitude);
00894 #endif
00895 }
00896 
00897 void btKinematicCharacterController::setGravity(const btVector3& gravity)
00898 {
00899         if (gravity.length2() > 0) setUpVector(-gravity);
00900 
00901         m_gravity = gravity.length();
00902 }
00903 
00904 btVector3 btKinematicCharacterController::getGravity() const
00905 {
00906         return -m_gravity * m_up;
00907 }

00930 bool btKinematicCharacterController::onGround () const
00931 {
00932         return (fabs(m_verticalVelocity) < SIMD_EPSILON) && (fabs(m_verticalOffset) < SIMD_EPSILON);
00933 }

00942         static btVector3 sUpAxisDirection[3] = { btVector3(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f), btVector3(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f), btVector3(0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f) };
00943         
00944         return sUpAxisDirection;

00955 
00956 void btKinematicCharacterController::setUp(const btVector3& up)
00957 {
00958         if (up.length2() > 0 && m_gravity > 0.0f)
00959         {
00960                 setGravity(-m_gravity * up.normalized());
00961                 return;
00962         }
00963 
00964         setUpVector(up);
00965 }
00966 
00967 void btKinematicCharacterController::setUpVector(const btVector3& up)
00968 {
00969         if (m_up == up)
00970                 return;
00971 
00972         btVector3 u = m_up;
00973 
00974         if (up.length2() > 0)
00975                 m_up = up.normalized();
00976         else
00977                 m_up = btVector3(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
00978 
00979         if (!m_ghostObject) return;
00980         btQuaternion rot = getRotation(m_up, u);
00981 
00982         //set orientation with new up
00983         btTransform xform;
00984         xform = m_ghostObject->getWorldTransform();
00985         btQuaternion orn = rot.inverse() * xform.getRotation();
00986         xform.setRotation(orn);
00987         m_ghostObject->setWorldTransform(xform);
00988 }
00989 
00990 btQuaternion btKinematicCharacterController::getRotation(btVector3& v0, btVector3& v1) const
00991 {
00992         if (v0.length2() == 0.0f || v1.length2() == 0.0f)
00993         {
00994                 btQuaternion q;
00995                 return q;
00996         }
00997 
00998         return shortestArcQuatNormalize2(v0, v1);
00999 }
